item.title: Rebecca Hall Is OK With Her Cats Waking Her at All Hours
item.description: “I find it weird when I go away and there are no noises of someone knocking over something or munching at the cat food or playing with a toy at 3 a.m. annoyingly keeping you up.”
item.dc:creator: Kathryn Shattuck

item.title: Could Marcello Hernández Be the Next ‘SNL’ Cast Member to Become a Superstar?
item.description: The comic’s new special, “American Boy,” shows that he has the leading-man charisma and hunger. His career will be interesting to watch.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zinoman
item.media:description: Marcello Hernández in his debut stand-up special, “American Boy.”

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Review: Go Westeros, Young Man
item.description: A lighter story about an itinerant sword-swinger cuts “Game of Thrones” down to small pleasures.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik
item.category: Knight of the Seven Kingdoms, A (TV Program)

item.title: ‘Knight of the Seven Kingdoms,’ ‘Game of Thrones’ Prequel, Explores Dunk and Egg
item.description: With no dragons and no warring dynasties, HBO’s “A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms” is the first test of whether the “Thrones” formula works on a human scale.
item.dc:creator: Alex Marshall
item.category: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms (TV Program)

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Season 2, Episode 2 Recap: Dirty Work
item.description: Viewers got extra intimate this week with the hard physical realities of life in the emergency ward.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins
item.media:description: Mel (Taylor Dearden, left, with Jesse Lambright) didn’t seem to realize she was being hit on, but it’s probably just as well.

item.title: Holly Hunter Reaches for the Stars
item.description: In “Star Trek: Starfleet Academy,” she got to play a few things she never had in her varied career: a space captain and a woman over 400 years old.
item.dc:creator: Alexis Soloski
item.media:credit: Erik Tanner for The New York Times
item.media:description: “Being an actor,” Hunter said, is “like playing the lottery.” Her job, as she sees it, is “to show up and do the most you can and surrender.”

item.title: ‘Riot Women’ Review: Women of a Certain Rage
item.description: There’s much more to Sally Wainwright’s series about middle-aged punk rockers than the music.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik
item.media:description: Saved by rock ’n’ roll: from left, Joanna Scanlan, Lorraine Ashbourne, Amelia Bullmore, Rosalie Craig, Tamsin Greig and Kam Chandeep Uppal in “Riot Women.”

item.title: Tony Dokoupil’s Road Trip on CBS News Hits a Rough Patch
item.description: A stretch of big news revealed growing pains for CBS’s new evening anchor and problems with its Bari Weiss-era philosophy.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik
item.media:description: Tony Dokoupil, the new anchor of “CBS Evening News,” interviewed President Trump in a factory near Detroit on Tuesday night. Dokoupil has been broadcasting from different cities since his debut last week.

item.title: In ‘Ponies,’ Emilia Clarke Is Done With Dragons
item.description: The “Game of Thrones” actress plays a fledgling spy in “Ponies,” a Cold-War era drama that takes her career in a new direction.
item.dc:creator: Imogen West-Knights and Charlotte Hadden
item.media:credit: Charlotte Hadden for The New York Times

item.title: 10 Steamy Books Like ‘Heated Rivalry’
item.description: Steamy love stories starring athletes and top-notch yearners will tide you over until your next trip to the cottage.
item.dc:creator: Martine Thompson

item.title: Seth Meyers Never Guessed Trump Was Such a Milk Fan
item.description: The “Late Night” host said there was no way President Trump drank milk, “unless someone tricked you into thinking your Diet Coke came from a cow.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)
Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)

item.title: Tessa Thompson in ‘Hedda,’ and More Theater to Stream
item.description: Other picks include “Bat Out of Hell: The Musical,” a new season of Playing on Air podcasts and “Lazarus,” featuring the music of David Bowie.
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Vincentelli
item.media:credit: Parisa Taghizadeh/Amazon Prime, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Tessa Thompson, right, in her Golden Globe-nominated performance in “Hedda.”

item.title: Laura Dave on Her Favorite Books and the Sequel to ‘The Last Thing He Told Me’
item.description: “It’s my comfort book,” she says of the comic novel about a busted marriage. Her own new thriller is a sequel to “The Last Thing He Told Me.”
item.category: The First Time I Saw Him (Book)
The Last Thing He Told Me: A Novel (Book)
The Last Thing He Told Me (TV Program)

item.title: Colbert Jokes That Trump Has Found ‘a New National Bird’
item.description: “You got to hand it to that auto worker for getting under Trump’s skin,” Stephen Colbert said after the president appeared to flip off a heckling worker at a Ford plant.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)
The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: The Art of a Good Awards-Show Speech
item.description: Demi Moore nailed it at last year’s Globes, and so did Teyana Taylor this year. The best acceptances keep in mind four key guidelines.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan

item.title: Stephen Colbert Accuses Trump of ‘Invading Minnesota’
item.description: “Has anyone told him that they don’t have oil?” Colbert said of the president’s plan to send 1,000 more immigration officers to Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)

item.title: Kiefer Sutherland Is Arrested After Assaulting Ride-Share Driver, Police Say
item.description: The actor also made “criminal threats” toward the driver, according to the Los Angeles police.
item.dc:creator: Matt Stevens
item.media:description: Kiefer Sutherland was released from custody after posting a $50,000 bond, according to county jail records available online.

item.title: Ricky Gervais’s Golden Globe Win for His Stand-Up Special Sends a Bad Message
item.description: That “Ricky Gervais: Mortality” won for best comedy sends a message about the lack of respect given to stand-up.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zinoman

item.title: Jon Stewart Skewers Trump as ‘Acting President of Venezuela’
item.description: “Doesn’t your oath of office to America have a noncompete?” the “Daily Show” host asked President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)
The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: At the Golden Globes, the Stars of ‘Heated Rivalry’ Scored Points With Fans
item.description: A Golden Globes appearance by the stars of “Heated Rivalry,” HBO Max’s show about gay hockey players, reflected how it has built a big-tent fan base.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta
item.media:credit: Kevork Djansezian/CBS Broadcasting, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Connor Storrie, left, and Hudson Williams presenting at the Golden Globes ceremony.

item.title: ‘Tehran’ Review: Israel vs. Iran, Retold as a Spy Thriller
item.description: The third season of the Israeli series, rescheduled amid the recent surge of conflicts in the Middle East, finally premieres on Apple TV.
item.dc:creator: Mike Hale
item.media:description: Niv Sultan plays a Mossad agent embedded in Iran in “Tehran.”

item.title: Photos: Backstage With Teyana Taylor, Owen Cooper and More Golden Globe Winners
item.description: Rose Byrne, Owen Cooper, Seth Rogen, Teyana Taylor and other award winners in the spotlight.
item.dc:creator: Chantal Anderson
item.media:credit: Chantal Anderson for The New York Times

item.title: Nikki Glaser’s Monologue, Teyana Taylor’s Speech and Other Moments From the 2026 Globes
item.description: Nikki Glaser returned as host and killed, while Teyana Taylor delivered the speech of the night. Then there were those awful production choices.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Goodman
item.media:credit: Kevork Djansezian/CBS Broadcasting, via Associated Press
item.media:description: As Nikki Glaser served as Golden Globes host on Sunday night, her previous experience in the role paid off.

item.title: Ricky Gervais Won the Comedy Award. Wanda Sykes Got the Last Laugh.
item.description: Although Gervais has hosted the Golden Globes five times, he was not at the ceremony on Sunday night.
item.dc:creator: Marc Tracy

item.title: ‘Tell Me Lies,’ Plus 8 Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: The college-set drama returns and a “Game of Thrones” prequel premieres.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez
item.media:description: Jackson White and Grace Van Patten in “Tell Me Lies.”

item.title: Golden Globe Awards 2026: Best Looks From Teyana Taylor, Jennifer Lawrence and More
item.description: Sheer gowns, slouchy tuxedos, chunky-soled boots and more.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk
item.media:description: Teyana Taylor’s gown had cutouts that showed off some of her chest (and some of her backside).

item.title: ‘Adolescence’ Wins Golden Globe for Best Limited Series, Marking a Triumph for Owen Cooper
item.description: Netflix’s harrowing series about a 13-year-old British boy accused of killing a girl in his school became an immediate global hit last year.
item.dc:creator: Michaela Towfighi

item.title: Rhea Seehorn wins best actress in a TV drama for ‘Pluribus.’
item.dc:creator: Austin Considine

item.title: Owen Cooper of ‘Adolescence’ wins best supporting TV actor.
item.description: He prevailed in a battle of the breakout stars of 2025 over Tramell Tillman, of Apple TV’s mind-bending sci-fi thriller “Severance.”
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Egner
item.media:description: Owen Cooper previously won an Emmy and a Critics Choice award for his performance in “Adolescence.”

item.title: Golden Globes 2026 Photos: Stars of ‘Hamnet,’ ‘One Battle After Another’ and More
item.description: Our photographer is capturing behind-the-scenes moments with stars at Sunday night’s awards show.
item.dc:creator: Sinna Nasseri
item.media:credit: Sinna Nasseri for The New York Times

item.title: Golden Globes Winners 2026: Full List Including ’One Battle After Another,’ ‘Sinners’ and ‘Good Hang With Amy Poehler’
item.description: The winning films, TV shows, actors and production teams at the 2026 Golden Globe Awards.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez
item.media:credit: Rich Polk/Penske Media, via Getty Images
item.media:description: Chloé Zhao, center, accepting the award for best motion picture drama: “Hamnet.”

item.title: Jean Smart, Mark Ruffalo and Natasha Lyonne Wear Anti-ICE Pins at 2026 Golden Globes
item.description: Mark Ruffalo, Wanda Sykes, Natasha Lyonne and Jean Smart were among the celebrities taking part in the campaign.
item.dc:creator: Melena Ryzik
item.media:description: Mark Ruffalo wearing a “Be Good” pin on the red carpet.

item.title: How to Watch the Golden Globes 2026: Date, Time and Streaming
item.description: Nikki Glaser is back as host, there’s a new podcast category and “One Battle After Another” looks to have a big night.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr
item.category: If I Had Legs I'd Kick You (Movie)
